raw.title: [ARFC] Onboard BNBx to Aave V3 BNB Chain
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
---

Title: [ARFC] Onboard BNBx to Aave V3 BNB Chain
Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)
Date: 2024-05-27

---

### **Summary**
This ARFC proposes the addition of BNBx from Stader to Aave V3 BNB Chain to enhance LST liquidity and asset diversity.

## **Motivation**

BNBx is a liquid staked token of BNB from Stader. Users can freely mint BNBx in exchange for BNB deposits and earn yield from staking.

The Aave-Chan Initiative supports LST diversity in Aave V3 and looks to add more LST to the new BNB Chain deployment.

## **Specification**

Contract address: [0x1bdd3cf7f79cfb8edbb955f20ad99211551ba275](https://bscscan.com/token/0x1bdd3cf7f79cfb8edbb955f20ad99211551ba275)

| Parameter | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | No |
| Borrowable | Yes |
| Collateral Enabled | Yes |
| Supply Cap (BNBx) | 5,000 |
| Borrow Cap (BNBx) | 500 |
| Debt Ceiling | NA |
| LTV | 65.00% |
| LT | 70.00% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 7.50% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00% |
| Variable Base | 0.0% |
| Variable Slope1 | 7.00% |
| Variable Slope2 | 300.00% |
| Uoptimal | 45.00% |
| Reserve Factor | 15.00% |
| Stable Borrowing | Disabled |
| Flahloanable  | Yes |
| Siloed Borrowing | No |
| Borrowed in Isolation | No |

Risk Parameters have been provided by Risk Service Providers and ARFC has been updated.

## **Useful Links**

- Website: https://www.staderlabs.com/
- BNBx docs: https://binance.docs.staderlabs.com/
- [TEMP CHECK](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-onboard-bnbx-on-aave-v3-bnb-chain/16850)
- [TEMP CHECK Snapshot](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x9510ea1d3c9fd0f1fd67b05860ca2f1dafb65b983ff1f81d962b7dea0c47b13b)

## Disclaimer

The ACI is not presenting this ARFC on behalf of any third party and is not compensated for creating this ARFC.

## Next Steps

1. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage
2. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.title: [ARFC] Aave V3 Deployment on BNB Chain
raw.author: 0x329c54289Ff5D6B7b7daE13592C6B1EDA1543eD4
raw.body:
Title: [ARFC] Aave V3 Deployment on BNB Chain

Author: @marczeller - Aave-Chan Initiative

Date: 2023-04-04

## **Summary**:

This ARFC proposes the deployment of Aave V3 on the BNB Chain, expanding Aave's presence and tapping into the growing DeFi ecosystem and user base of BNB Chain.

## **Abstract**:

Upon approval by the Aave community, Aave V3 will be deployed on the BNB Chain with a selection of suitable assets for collateral, including BNB, WBTC, BETH, WETH, USDC, and USDT. This deployment aims to enhance the growth and collaboration between the Aave and BNB Chain communities, providing new opportunities for both ecosystems.

## **Motivation**:

Deploying Aave V3 on the BNB Chain presents potential benefits for both Aave and BNB Chain ecosystems. Aave would gain access to BNB Chain's user base, DeFi ecosystem, and potential additional revenue. In return, BNB Chain would benefit from having a flagship DeFi project like Aave on its platform, further diversifying DeFi options available to its users.

## **Specification**:

The ARFC suggests deploying Aave V3 on the BNB Chain with the following assets for collateral: CAKE, BNB, BTCB, WETH, USDC, and USDT. The table below provides the suggested risk parameters for each asset.

|Risk Parameter|CAKE|BNB|BTCB|WETH|USDC|USDT|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|Isolation Mode|YES|NO|NO|NO|NO|NO|
|Enable Borrow|NO|NO|YES|YES|YES|YES|
|Borrowable in Isolation|NO|NO|NO|NO|YES|YES|
|Enable Collateral|YES|YES|YES|YES|YES|YES|
|Emode Category|N/A|N/A|N/A|N/A|N/A|N/A|
|Loan To Value|55.00%|70.00%|70.00%|80.00%|77.50%|75.00%|
|Liquidation Threshold|61.00%|75.00%|75.00%|82.50%|80.00%|80.00%|
|Liquidation Bonus|10.00%|10.00%|10.00%|10.00%|5.00%|5.00%|
|Reserve Factor|20.00%|20.00%|20.00%|15.00%|10.00%|10.00%|
|Liquidation Protocol Fee|10.00%|10.00%|10.00%|10.00%|10.00%|10.00%|
|Borrow Cap|1,800,000|42,000|115|3,300.00|20,000,000*|20,000,000*|
|Supply Cap|5,300,000|46,000|210|6,000.00|50,000,000*|50,000,000*|
|Debt Ceiling|$10,000,000|N/A|N/A|N/A|N/A|N/A|
|Stable Borrowing|NO|NO|NO|NO|NO|NO|
|uOptimal|45%|45%|45%|80%|90%|80%|
|Base|0%|0%|0%|1%|0%|0%|
|Slope1|7%|7%|7%|3.80%|4%|4%|
|Slope2|300%|300%|300%|80%|60%|75%|

## **Deployment Checklist:**

- Risk service providers feedback ✔
- BGD Labs [Infrastructure/technical evaluation Report](https://governance.aave.com/t/bgd-aave-bnb-chain-infrastructure-technical-evaluation/13752)  ✔ 
- Oracle recommendation ✔ ([Chainlink](https://docs.chain.link/data-feeds/price-feeds/addresses?network=bnb-chain))
- The graph support ✔
- Cross-chain messaging infrastructure for governance  ✔ 

## **Disclaimer**
The Aave-Chan Initiative (ACI) is not compensated in any form by Binance & BNB for creating this ARFC proposal. This ARFC has been prepared solely to facilitate community discussion.
At the time of writing, the author owns ~70$ worth of assets on the BNB chain.

## **Next Steps**
1. Integrate BGD Labs Infrastructure/technical evaluation report once available.
2. Refine the ARFC based on community feedback and risk service provider recommendations.
3. If consensus is reached and the proposal is refined, submit the ARFC for a snapshot vote for final approval.
4. If consensus is reached, submit a deployment AIP to activate Aave V3 BNB.


## **Copyright**
Copyright and related rights waived via CC0.

raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
---
### [ARFC]  Onboard sUSDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum 

### Author:  ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)

### Date: 2024-04-01

---

### **Summary**

This is an ARFC to seek approval for the addition of sUSDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum, following the consensus reached in the [TEMP CHECK](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x3263dbee34f5afe513a1a6c5bcd5207684cee03473e1b3d7616993dbd87ab881) stage.

### **Motivation**

As discussed in the TEMP CHECK, Ethena's synthetic dollar, USDe, provides a stable crypto-native solution for a cash and carry structured product. The staked version of USDe, sUSDe, earns yield from the protocol and has high potential for strong borrow demand. 

### **Specification**

sUSDe: [0x9d39a5de30e57443bff2a8307a4256c8797a3497](https://etherscan.io/token/0x9d39a5de30e57443bff2a8307a4256c8797a3497)

### Risk Parameters

Risk parameters have been provided by Chaos Labs in the ARFC discussion thread. 

Initial Risk Parameters are the following:

| Parameter | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | Yes |
| Borrowable | No |
| Collateral Enabled | Yes |
| Supply Cap (sUSDe) | 85M |
| Debt Ceiling |40M |
| LTV | 72.00% |
| LT | 75.00% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 8.50% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00%|
|Flashloanable|No|
|Siloed Borrowing|No|
|Borrowed in Isolation|No|
|Emode|No|

### **Useful Links**

[TEMP CHECK](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-onboard-susde-to-aave-v3-on-ethereum/16840)
[TEMP CHECK Snapshot](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x3263dbee34f5afe513a1a6c5bcd5207684cee03473e1b3d7616993dbd87ab881)

### Disclaimer

This proposal is powered by Skywards. The Aave Chan Initiative is not directly affiliated with Ethena and did not receive compensation for creation this proposal.

### **Next Steps**

1. Collect community & service providers feedback on this ARFC.
2. Escalate the proposal to ARFC snapshot stage if feedback is positive.
3. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)

raw.title: [ARFC] Onboard fdUSD to Aave v3 on BSC
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
Title: [ARFC] Onboard fdUSD to Aave v3 on BSC 

Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)

Date: 2024-01-23

# Summary

The proposal aims to onboard fdUSD, a fiat-backed stablecoin, to the Aave v3 protocol on the BNB Chain (BSC).

## **Motivation**

fdUSD is a dollar-pegged stablecoin that provides stability and value preservation for users on the BNB Chain. It is issued by FD121 Ltd. (First Digital Labs), a subsidiary of First Digital Group that is incorporated in Hong Kong.

As part of the approved [deployment on BSC](https://governance.aave.com/t/arfc-aave-v3-deployment-on-bnb-chain/12609), fdUSD will be a key asset for supply liquidity and borrow demand. As this is a net-new asset for Aave, we propose this ARFC to confirm community approval to add fdUSD as an asset for the launch of the BSC deployment of Aave. The proposal seeks to leverage the strong demand for stablecoins and the growing popularity of the BSC ecosystem to provide users with enhanced liquidity options.

**Benefits of listing fdUSD:**

- Enhanced liquidity options for Aave users on the BSC deployment
- Increased utility for fdUSD as it becomes available for lending and borrowing
- Strengthened collaboration between Aave and the BSC ecosystem, fostering growth and innovation
- Aave’s BSC deployment will be integrated with Binance’s web3 wallet, making easy access for Binance users to deposit fdUSD in Aave through the Earn program.

**Market Impact:**

Listing fdUSD contributes to the overall growth of Aave by expanding the range of assets available for lending and borrowing on the BSC pool.

As a main asset for use in Binance launch pools, we expect there to be good borrow demand for this asset.

**Chains to be deployed/listed:** 

The intention is to list fdUSD on the Aave’s upcoming BNB Chain deployment.

**Proof of Liquidity (POL) and Deposit Commitments:**

- Collaborations with external parties are in place to bootstrap liquidity and contribute to a robust and diverse liquidity environment for fdUSD. BNB chain partners have committed to providing an initial supply side liquidity of up to 5m fdUSD.
- Plans for implementing liquidity mining programs tailored to Aave’s BSC deployment are under consideration.

## Specification

Ticker: fdUSD

Contract Adress: [0xc5f0f7b66764f6ec8c8dff7ba683102295e16409](https://bscscan.com/address/0xc5f0f7b66764f6ec8c8dff7ba683102295e16409)

Chainlink Oracle: [0x390180e80058a8499930f0c13963ad3e0d86bfc9](https://bscscan.com/address/0x390180e80058a8499930f0c13963ad3e0d86bfc9)

Based on Risk Service providers, the following Risk Parameters are proposed:

|Risk Parameter | FDUSD|
|--- | ---|
|Isolation Mode | NO|
|Enable Borrow | YES|
|Borrowable in Isolation | YES|
|Enable Collateral | YES|
|Emode Category | NO|
|Loan To Value | 70%|
|Liquidation Threshold | 75%|
|Liquidation Bonus | 5.00%|
|Reserve Factor | 20.00%|
|Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00%|
|Borrow Cap | 7,500,000|
|Supply Cap | 8,000,000|
|Debt Ceiling | N/A|
|Stable Borrowing | NO|
|uOptimal | 90%|
|Base | 0%|
|Slope1 | 6%|
|Slope2 | 75%|

## **Useful Links**

- [fdUSD](https://firstdigitallabs.com/) - First Digital Labs website.
- [fdUSD Whitepaper](https://firstdigitallabs.com/workspace/uploads/FDUSD-Whitepaper-25216064ca0cc8.pdf)
- TEMP CHECK https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-onboard-fdusd-to-aave-v3-on-bsc/16131
- Snapshot https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0xd5ffa15a59b5b29cd4ba2dc4439f1cfb57673faa4d8644120a02dbc5b47505d5

## **Disclaimer**

ACI worked with relevant partners in the BNB Chain ecosystem to craft this proposal. ACI holds no conflict of interest or relationship with the fdUSD protocol, and no compensation has been received for publishing this proposal.

## **Next Steps**

1. If consensus on ARFC stage is reached and risk service providers provide feedback on risk parameters, escalate to ARFC snapshot stage.
2. If ARFC snapshot stage outcome is YAE, escalate to AIP stage

## Copyright:

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.title: [ARFC] Aave V3 Deployment on GnosisChain
raw.author: 0x57ab7ee15cE5ECacB1aB84EE42D5A9d0d8112922
raw.body:
---
Title: [ARFC] Aave V3 Deployment on GnosisChain
Author: Marc Zeller @marczeller - Aave Chan Initiative
Date: 2023-08-31
---

## **Summary**:

This ARFC proposes the deployment of Aave V3 on the GnosisChain. Following the positive feedback from the TEMP CHECK, the assets considered for this deployment include wETH, wstETH, GNO, USDC, wxDAI, and EURe.

## **Motivation**:

The GnosisChain, with its historical significance in the ecosystem and its roots in the POA network, presents a valuable opportunity for Aave. The friendly fork RMM Market with RealT on the GnosisChain has already showcased the potential synergies between Aave's codebase and GnosisChain. This ARFC seeks to further these synergies, providing mutual benefits for both ecosystems.

## **Specification**:

The ARFC suggests deploying Aave V3 on the GnosisChain with the following assets and risk parameters:

| Risk Parameter          | wETH  | wstETH | GNO | USDC | wxDAI | EURe |
|-------------------------|-------|--------|-----|------|-------|------|
| Isolation Mode          | NO    | NO     | YES | NO   | NO    | NO   |
| Borrowable in Isolation           | NO  | NO   | NO  | YES  | YES   | NO  |
| Stable Borrow         | NO    | NO     | NO | NO   | NO    | NO   |
| Enable Borrow           | YES   | YES    | NO  | YES  | YES   | YES  |
| Enable Collateral       | YES   | YES    | YES | YES  | YES   | NO   |
| Loan To Value           | 80.5% | 71%    | 31% | 77%  | 77%   | N/A  |
| Liquidation Threshold   | 83%   | 76%    | 36% | 80%  | 80%   | N/A  |
| Liquidation Bonus       | 6%    | 6%     | 10% | 5% | 5%  | N/A  |
| Reserve Factor          | 15%   | 15%    | N/A | 10%  | 10%   | 15%  |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee| 10%   | 10%    | 10% | 20%  | 20%   | 10%  |
| Supply Cap              | 4000 wETH | 4000 wsETH | 30000 | 1M USDC | 1.5M xDAI | 1.5M EURe |
| Borrow Cap              | 3500 wETH | 400 wstETH | N/A | 1M USDC | 1.5M xDAI | 1.5M EURe |
| Debt Ceiling            | N/A   | N/A    | 5M$ | N/A  | N/A   | N/A  |
| uOptimal                | 80%   | 45%    | N/A | 90%  | 90%   | 90%  |
| Base                    | 0%    | 0%     | N/A | 0%   | 0%    | 0%   |
| Slope1                  | 3.3%  | 7%   | N/A | 4% | 4%    | 4%   |
| Slope2                  | 80%   | 300%    | N/A | 75%  | 75%   | 75%  |

Furthermore, we recommend the following parameters for the ETH eMode pool:

|Parameter|ETH eMode Pool|
| --- | --- |
|Liquidation Threshold (LT)|93%|
|Loan-To-Value (LTV)|90%|
|Liquidation Bonus (LB)|1%|

Even if both assets currently lack the maturity to be considered, the ACI is supportive mid-term of onboarding both wGHO and sDAI onboarding in the GnosisChain V3 pool.

## **Deployment Checklist**:

- Risk service providers feedback ✅
- GnosisChain [Infrastructure/technical evaluation Report](https://governance.aave.com/t/bgd-aave-gnosischain-infrastructure-technical-evaluation/14915) ✅
- Oracle support ✅
- The graph support ✅
- Cross-chain messaging infrastructure for governance ❓

## **Disclaimer**:

The Aave Chan Initiative (ACI) is not compensated in any form by Gnosis or any affiliated entities for creating this ARFC proposal. At the time of writing, 

- The ACI is a customer of Monerium (EURe).
- The author is a Gnosischain staker for ~270 GNO.

## **Next Steps**:

1. Submit the ARFC for a snapshot vote for approval.
3. If consensus is reached, proceed with the deployment AIP vote to activate Aave V3 on GnosisChain.

## **Copyright**:

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

decision.summary: The proposal to deploy Aave V3 on zkSync is strongly supported by unanimous voting timeline metrics, positive TVL impact, and a majority of forum sentiment favoring deployment despite some transparency concerns. Historical similar proposals for expanding Aave deployments have passed with strong support and positive market outcomes.
key_arguments_for: Deployment leverages zk-Rollup scalability and cost efficiency to reduce gas fees and increase throughput.
Strong vote timeline stability and unanimous lead ratios support the YAE option.
Positive TVL impact (+1.22%) indicates increased liquidity and adoption potential.
Similar past proposals expanding Aave deployments passed with overwhelming support and positive lessons.
Community forum shows general support for deployment with some technical and transparency questions that do not outweigh benefits.
key_arguments_against: Some forum participants express concerns about transparency of token allocations and prior communications.
Technical complexity and tooling challenges deploying on zkSync noted.
Initial liquidity on zkSync is relatively low and native USDC is early stage.
A few negative sentiment comments highlight potential risks and demand rigorous accountability.

evidence.quote: Forum discussion shows mixed sentiment with 3 positive, 9 negative, and 19 neutral comments; first two comments summarize negative concerns on transparency and positive support for deployment.
Unique voters 344 with perfect lead ratio (1.0) and stability for YAE option indicate strong vote consensus.
Similar past Aave deployment proposals also recommended 'YAE' with strong majorities and positive market/TVL impacts.

decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on timeline metrics, forum sentiment, and historical lessons rather than ex-post tally.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• The proposal enjoys perfect timeline stability and unanimous early lead for YAE, signaling strong voter consensus.
• Forum sentiment is generally supportive with positive comments outweighing negatives, reflecting community alignment with the recommendation.
• Positive TVL impact (+1.22%) suggests increased liquidity and user adoption potential from deploying on zkSync.
• Similar historical Aave deployment proposals passed with strong support and positive market reactions, reinforcing the soundness of this change.
• Despite some transparency and technical concerns in the forum, these do not outweigh the benefits and strong vote momentum.
• The recommendation to 'Change' mirrors aggregated forum opinion, ensuring the decision reflects community views while maximizing long-term DAO health.
